abstract: Zentiva, the Czech drug company, agreed Monday to be acquired by Sanofi-Aventis after Sanofi raised its bid. The new deal, valued at $2.6 billion, will give Zentiva shareholders $69.71 per share in what amounts to a 9.5 percent increase on the original offer, which Zentiva had rejected.
lead_paragraph: Zentiva, the Czech drug company, agreed Monday to be acquired by Sanofi-Aventis after Sanofi raised its bid. The new deal, valued at $2.6 billion, will give Zentiva shareholders $69.71 per share in what amounts to a 9.5 percent increase on the original offer, which Zentiva had rejected.

headline.main: Sanofi Raises Zentiva Offer to Win Board Support
